Package org.jlab.coda.jevio

Interface IEvioReader

All Known Implementing Classes:
EvioReader, EvioReaderUnsyncV4, EvioReaderUnsyncV6, EvioReaderV4, EvioReaderV6
public interface IEvioReader
This interface is used to abstract various file and buffer reading functions. There are different readers for various evio versions and which are synchronized or unsynchronized. Created by timmer on 10/23/18.

  • Method Details

    • setBuffer

      void setBuffer(ByteBuffer buf) throws EvioException, IOException
      This method can be used to avoid creating additional EvioReader objects by reusing this one with another buffer. The method close() is called before anything else.
      Parameters:
      buf - ByteBuffer to be read
      Throws:
      IOException - if read failure
      EvioException - if buf is null; if first block number != 1 when checkBlkNumSeq arg is true

    • isClosed

      boolean isClosed()
      Has close() been called (without reopening by calling setBuffer(ByteBuffer))?
      Returns:
      true if this object closed, else false.

    • checkBlockNumberSequence

      boolean checkBlockNumberSequence()
      Is this reader checking the block number sequence and throwing an exception if it's not sequential and starting with 1?
      Returns:
      true if checking block number sequence, else false

    • addHeaderRecoveryCheck

      void addHeaderRecoveryCheck()
      Invoke to try header recovery when block headers aren’t where expected currently, having extraneous words is supported it doesn't handle missing header words yet (more difficult)

    • getByteOrder

      ByteOrder getByteOrder()
      Get the byte order of the file/buffer being read.
      Returns:
      byte order of the file/buffer being read.

    • getEvioVersion

      int getEvioVersion()
      Get the evio version number.
      Returns:
      evio version number.

    • getPath

      String getPath()
      Get the path to the file.
      Returns:
      path to the file

    • getParser

      EventParser getParser()
      Get the file/buffer parser.
      Returns:
      file/buffer parser.

    • setParser

      void setParser(EventParser parser)
      Set the file/buffer parser.
      Parameters:
      parser - file/buffer parser.

    • getDictionaryXML

      String getDictionaryXML()
      Get the XML format dictionary if there is one.
      Returns:
      XML format dictionary, else null.

    • hasDictionaryXML

      boolean hasDictionaryXML()
      Does this evio file have an associated XML dictionary?
      Returns:
      true if this evio file has an associated XML dictionary, else false

    • getFirstEvent

      EvioEvent getFirstEvent()
      Get the "first" event if there is one. It's also called the Beginning-Of-Run event. This event is defined once but included in each of the related split files written out.
      Returns:
      the first event if it existed, else null.

    • hasFirstEvent

      boolean hasFirstEvent()
      Does this evio file have an associated first event? It's also called the Beginning-Of-Run event. This event is defined once but included in each of the related split files written out.
      Returns:
      true if this evio file has an associated first event, else false

    • getNumEventsRemaining

      int getNumEventsRemaining() throws IOException, EvioException
      Get the number of events remaining in the file. Useful only if doing a sequential read.
      Returns:
      number of events remaining in the file
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access
      EvioException - if failed reading from coda v3 file

    • getByteBuffer

      ByteBuffer getByteBuffer()
      Get the byte buffer being read directly or corresponding to the event file. Not a very useful method. For files, it works only for evio format versions 2,3 and returns the internal buffer containing an evio block if using sequential access (for example files > 2.1 GB). It returns the memory mapped buffer otherwise. For reading buffers it returns the buffer being read.
      Returns:
      the byte buffer being read (in certain cases).

    • fileSize

      long fileSize()
      Get the size of the file being read, in bytes. For small files, obtain the file size using the memory mapped buffer's capacity.
      Returns:
      the file size in bytes

    • getFirstBlockHeader

      IBlockHeader getFirstBlockHeader()
      This returns the FIRST block (physical record) header.
      Returns:
      the first block header.

    • getEvent

      EvioEvent getEvent(int index) throws IOException, EvioException
      Get the event in the file/buffer at a given index (starting at 1). As useful as this sounds, most applications will probably call parseNextEvent() or parseEvent(int) instead, since it combines getting an event with parsing it.

      Parameters:
      index - number of event desired, starting at 1, from beginning of file/buffer
      Returns:
      the event in the file/buffer at the given index or null if none
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access
      EvioException - if failed read due to bad file/buffer format; if out of memory; if index out of bounds; if object closed

    • parseEvent

      EvioEvent parseEvent(int index) throws IOException, EvioException
      This is a workhorse method. It retrieves the desired event from the file/buffer, and then parses it SAX-like. It will drill down and uncover all structures (banks, segments, and tagsegments) and notify any interested listeners.
      Parameters:
      index - number of event desired, starting at 1, from beginning of file/buffer
      Returns:
      the parsed event at the given index or null if none
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access
      EvioException - if failed read due to bad file/buffer format; if out of memory; if index out of bounds; if object closed

    • nextEvent

      EvioEvent nextEvent() throws IOException, EvioException
      Get the next event in the file/buffer. As useful as this sounds, most applications will probably call parseNextEvent() instead, since it combines getting the next event with parsing the next event.

      Although this method can get events in versions 4+, it now delegates that to another method. No changes were made to this method from versions 1-3 in order to read the version 4 format as it is subset of versions 1-3 with variable block length.

      Returns:
      the next event in the file. On error it throws an EvioException. On end of file, it returns null.
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access
      EvioException - if failed read due to bad buffer format; if object closed

    • parseNextEvent

      EvioEvent parseNextEvent() throws IOException, EvioException
      This is a workhorse method. It retrieves the next event from the file/buffer, and then parses it SAX-like. It will drill down and uncover all structures (banks, segments, and tagsegments) and notify any interested listeners.
      Returns:
      the event that was parsed. On error it throws an EvioException. On end of file, it returns null.
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access
      EvioException - if read failure or bad format if object closed

    • parseEvent

      void parseEvent(EvioEvent evioEvent) throws EvioException
      This will parse an event, SAX-like. It will drill down and uncover all structures (banks, segments, and tagsegments) and notify any interested listeners.

      As useful as this sounds, most applications will probably call parseNextEvent() instead, since it combines getting the next event with parsing the next event.

      This method is only called by synchronized methods and therefore is not synchronized.

      Parameters:
      evioEvent - the event to parse.
      Throws:
      EvioException - if bad format

    • getEventArray

      byte[] getEventArray(int eventNumber) throws EvioException, IOException
      Get an evio bank or event in byte array form.
      Parameters:
      eventNumber - number of event of interest (starting at 1).
      Returns:
      array containing bank's/event's bytes.
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access
      EvioException - if eventNumber out of bounds (starts at 1); if the event number does not correspond to an existing event; if object closed

    • getEventBuffer

      ByteBuffer getEventBuffer(int eventNumber) throws EvioException, IOException
      Get an evio bank or event in ByteBuffer form.
      Parameters:
      eventNumber - number of event of interest
      Returns:
      buffer containing bank's/event's bytes.
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access
      EvioException - if eventNumber is out of bounds; if the event number does not correspond to an existing event; if object closed

    • rewind

      void rewind() throws IOException, EvioException
      The equivalent of rewinding the file. What it actually does is set the position of the file/buffer back to where it was after calling the constructor - after the first header. This method, along with the two position() and the close() method, allows applications to treat files in a normal random access manner.
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access or buffer/file read
      EvioException - if object closed

    • position

      long position() throws IOException, EvioException
      This is equivalent to obtaining the current position in the file. What it actually does is return the position of the buffer. This method, along with the rewind(), position(int) and the close() method, allows applications to treat files in a normal random access manner. Only meaningful to evio versions 1-3 and for sequential reading.

      Returns:
      the position of the buffer; -1 if version 4+
      Throws:
      IOException - if error accessing file
      EvioException - if object closed

    • close

      void close() throws IOException
      This is closes the file, but for buffers it only sets the position to 0. This method, along with the rewind() and the two position() methods, allows applications to treat files in a normal random access manner.
      Throws:
      IOException - if error accessing file

    • getCurrentBlockHeader

      IBlockHeader getCurrentBlockHeader()
      This returns the current (active) block (physical record) header. Since most users have no interest in physical records, this method should not be used.
      Returns:
      the current block header.

    • gotoEventNumber

      EvioEvent gotoEventNumber(int evNumber) throws IOException, EvioException
      Go to a specific event in the file. The events are numbered 1..N. This number is transient--it is not part of the event as stored in the evio file. In versions 4 and up this is just a wrapper on getEvent(int).
      Parameters:
      evNumber - the event number in a 1..N counting sense, from the start of the file.
      Returns:
      the specified event in file or null if there's an error or nothing at that event #.
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access
      EvioException - if object closed

    • toXMLFile

      WriteStatus toXMLFile(String path) throws IOException, EvioException
      Rewrite the file to XML (not including dictionary and "first" event).
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the XML file.
      Returns:
      the status of the write.
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access
      EvioException - if object closed

    • toXMLFile

      WriteStatus toXMLFile(String path, boolean hex) throws IOException, EvioException
      Rewrite the file to XML (not including dictionary and "first" event).
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the XML file.
      hex - if true, ints get displayed in hexadecimal
      Returns:
      the status of the write.
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access
      EvioException - if object closed

    • toXMLFile

      WriteStatus toXMLFile(String path, IEvioProgressListener progressListener) throws IOException, EvioException
      Rewrite the file to XML (not including dictionary and "first" event).
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the XML file.
      progressListener - and optional progress listener, can be null.
      Returns:
      the status of the write.
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access
      EvioException - if object closed
      See Also:
      • IEvioProgressListener

    • toXMLFile

      WriteStatus toXMLFile(String path, IEvioProgressListener progressListener, boolean hex) throws IOException, EvioException
      Rewrite the file to XML (not including dictionary and "first" event).
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the XML file.
      progressListener - and optional progress listener, can be null.
      hex - if true, ints get displayed in hexadecimal
      Returns:
      the status of the write.
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access
      EvioException - if object closed
      See Also:
      • IEvioProgressListener

    • getEventCount

      int getEventCount() throws IOException, EvioException
      This is the number of events in the file/buffer. Any dictionary or first event are not included in the count.
      Returns:
      the number of events in the file/buffer.
      Throws:
      IOException - if failed file access
      EvioException - if read failure; if object closed

    • getBlockCount

      int getBlockCount() throws EvioException
      This is the number of records in the file/buffer including the empty record or trailer at the end.
      Returns:
      the number of records in the file/buffer (estimate for version 3 files).
      Throws:
      EvioException - if object closed.
